thread.title: Jury convicts man in fatal shooting outside central NY bar
thread.title_full: Jury convicts man in fatal shooting outside central NY bar - WCAX.COM Local Vermont News, Weather and Sports-

author: wcax.com
title: Jury convicts man in fatal shooting outside central NY bar
text:
UTICA, N.Y. (AP) - A central New York man has been has convicted of the fatal shooting of a 22-year-old woman outside a bar a year ago last week.
An Oneida County Court jury on Wednesday convicted 25-year-old Darnell Howard of Utica on charges that included second-degree murder, criminal possession of a weapon and reckless endangerment.
Prosecutors say Howard was on parole for the 2007 assault of a Utica police officer when he opened fire outside a bar in the nearby city of Rome on Oct. 4, 2014, hitting Rose Ortiz of Rome. Police said Ortiz was an innocent bystander.
Her family members and friends burst into tears when the verdict was announced.
Howard could face anywhere from 15 years in state prison to life, the minimum for second-degree murder. He's scheduled to be sentenced Dec. 2.
